content: a hand knitting pattern by suzi ashworth this pattern is designed to accompany the 2024 folkestone harbour yarn naturally dyed advent calendar and will make a fair-isle inspired colourwork triangular mini shawl approx 130cm long by 32cm at its widest point yarn/tool requirements 24 x 10g/42 5m 75% superwash merino/25% nylon sock weight mini skeins 22 x solid colours and 2 x variegated colourways 1 x 100g/425m 75% superwash merino/25% nylon sock weight yarn in cream/white/undyed 3mm knitting needles i recommend using very long single points or cabled needles as the max width of the shawl is 32cm approx tools and notions stitch markers scissors or snips wool needle for ends blocking equipment yarn winder this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only the pattern may not be copied resold or redistributed in any way day 25 rose stem row 380 - 417 continuing to knit in the same i cord edge + left edge decrease pattern as row 211 & 212 knit until row 417 introduce cc green 3 as needed the rose stem is knitted entirely from the chart with no repeat row 418 419 row 418 rs k3 sl 3 turn row 419 ws k3 sl3 turn cast off in your preferred method i like the knitted cast off see glossary sew in all ends and trim ends neatly blocking see glossary for how to will really benefit this mini shawl and will help stretch out any irregularities in your gauge knitted cast off knit the first two stitches using the tip of the left needle pick up the first stitch that you knitted from the right needle and lift it up over the second stitch and drop it off the right needle leaving only 1 stitch on your right needle knit one more stitch from the left needle and again pick up the previous stitch on the right needle pull it up over and drop off the needle as before repeat this process all the way along your row until you are left with 1 stitch on your right needle and no more stitches to knit on your left needle cut the yarn leaving a tail and thread it through the last loop to secure it before weaving in the end to hide and secure it you may want to cast off using a knitting needle one size larger eg a 3 25mm or 3 5mm to ensure that your cast off is not too tight note please refer to glossary section for tips on washing and care of naturally dyed yarns copyright 2024 suzi ashworth for folkestone harbour yarn day 24 english rose row 363 - 379 continuing to knit in the same i cord edge + left edge decrease pattern as row 211 & 212 knit until row 379 introduce cc green 3 & cc pink 3 as needed the rose is knitted entirely from the chart with no repeat cut cc pink 3 leaving a tail to sew in later stitch count 3
